entry.title: Updates so far
entry.content:
It’s been a year since my last update. Time does fly.

Just want to say I am still alive. Busy, but constantly learning new stuff.

Couple of things to “brag” about:

  • Currently doing an Internship with Medallia in Palo Alto Bay Area, small (relatively speaking) company but people are really NICE!

  • Spent my last semester build a open source project database. Its initial version is about to be released (soon). Watch my Github account if you are interested in learning more.

  • Lost almost 20lbs so far

Insipred by an blogger, I will start a series of tutorials on topic like Machine Learning and Data Science. It should be a new learning experience on both ends.

entry.title: Summer 2015 Internship/Part-time with Tencent
entry.content:
During the summer of 2015, I had this chance working with Tencent Hangzhou team. This journal will mainly be about this experience.

Tencent Hangzhou is a, relatively-speaking, small team. We had about less than 50 people working full-time. Yet, majority (all except 3 people) of them are developers. The main business done there are still CONFIDENTIAL (I signed the contract that I should not talk about it in public domain), yet I was surprised to find out that I could talk about my project (I guess that means my project is not important maybe?)

I did a Hadoop Version of Kmeans with Benchmark and Optimization .

entry.title: Domain name expires
entry.content:
Just realize my old domain name

wes-ivy.me

just expired.

Glad I have this back-up.

BTW, domain name 120usd/yr, what you think?

entry.title: Back to China!
entry.content:
It’s been a while before I realize my last post was last year Nov 18.

I agree with you, I’m lazy~

Anyway, many things happended over the past few mothes, and I would like to write them down (So I can refer to it years after).

  1. I got another gradute school admission offer from University of Wisconsin-Madison. TA position plus scholarship. Way better package thane the UCLA one. Yet, I have not decided where I should go for graduate school.

  2. I decided to spend the next 6 months in Hangzhou China for the following reasons: a) I believe family is very important, b) my working authorization expired (which I could extend, but I didn’t).

  3. Before going back to China, I spent my past 10 days in New Zealand. Thats right, New Zealand, the first country to see the sunrise. In fact, this post is writen in Auckland International Airport, where I have 2 hours before boarding the plane to Shanghai.

  4. I definitely will go back to U.S. for graudate school later this year. Which school? Not quite clear yet.

I’m back, China!

entry.title: First grad school admission
entry.content:
Last week, I received my first grad school admission offer!

Master of Science in Computer Science admission from UCLA(for those who don’t know, University of California Los Angeles!)

California, I’m coming!
